title.narrative: Partnership between TU Delft and Hanoi University of Natural Resources and Environment (HUNRE)

description.narrative: What are the results of the project?In order to further support and strengthen the collaboration that has been built up with HUNRE, TU Delft received funding to continue the collaboration with HUNRE. In concrete terms, this support entailed joint work on new teaching methods, material and case studies and having teams of Vietnamese young teachers collaborate with Dutch teachers and young professionals (eg PhDs and MSc graduates). This “staff exchange” works best in two directions: 1) Vietnamese staff stays in the Netherlands for a period of time to work with experts on their content and teaching materials 2) Dutch staff comes to Vietnam to help them take care of education and especially in case studies and practical assignments. For the time being, Vietnamese education focuses mainly on theory and much less on skills relevant to the labor market that you acquire through practice and cases. In addition, it is very useful for the cooperation to have Dutch students in Vietnam for a longer period of time through an internship or graduation process.Two young teachers from HUNRE came to Delft for a significant period (+/- 2 months) to work on updating their teaching materials, teaching methods and to develop research assignments that they can use in their work at the university. Visit of Professor Nhan, vice rector and dean, and Professor Thanh, management of HUNRE to the Amsterdam International Water Week where Professor Hhan presented during the conference. Two students from Rotterdam University of Applied Sciences did their graduation research at HUNRE in collaboration with the staff and students of HUNRE. They have been on HUNRE for 3 months; TU Delft staff paid a visit to HUNRE, together with Professor Emeritus Marcel Stive (contribution from TU Delft itself). Purchase of AKVO licenses to continue the practical research with regard to water quality using citizen science.This project is conducted in cooperation with: Hanoi University of Natural Resources and Environment.
